Article.ArticleTitle: Effects of Ozone Therapy on Chronic Arsenic Poisoning in Rats.

AbstractText: Arsenic (As) is a toxic metalloid that affects many organs through drinking water. This study aims to examine the efficacy of ozone therapy on chronic arsenic toxicity. Twenty-four male Wistar albino rats were housed in individual cages and grouped as control, As, O<sub>3</sub>, and As + O<sub>3.</sub> As was applied by adding 5 mg/kg/day in drinking water for 60 days. Ozone therapy was applied at 0.5 mg/kg/day (i.p.) O<sub>3</sub> in the last 5 days of the experimental period. Tissues were harvested and analyzed for histopathological injury and apoptotic markers. There was no significant difference between the As + O<sub>3</sub> and O<sub>3</sub> groups (p = 0.186 and p = 0.599) for light microscopic criteria: inflammatory cell infiltration and hydropic degeneration in liver tissue.In TUNEL assessments, similar outcomes were obtained in the control and As + O<sub>3</sub> groups. A statistically significant increase was observed in p53 and Caspase 3 (Casp-3) expression levels in the As group compared to the O<sub>3</sub> and As + O<sub>3</sub> groups. There was no significant difference between the As + O<sub>3</sub> and O<sub>3</sub> groups on peritubular hemorrhage and desquamation parameters in kidneys (p = 0.147 and p = 0.094). The KIM-1 expression level was significantly increased in the As group compared to the As + O<sub>3</sub> group (p = 0.01), and the Casp-3 expression level was not significantly changed in the O<sub>3</sub> group compared to the As + O<sub>3</sub> group (p = 0.59). In conclusion, it is determined that ozone therapy has ameliorative effects on the microscopic injury of liver and kidney tissues. In addition to microscopic improvement, KIM-1 gene expression levels were ameliorated in the kidneys. The apoptotic cell counts and the Casp-3 and p53 gene expression levels were decreased by O<sub>3</sub> administration. Thus, ozone therapy can be a treatment choice for As toxicity.
